item.title: Smart Player API sample: Are you still watching?
item.description:
A new Smart Player API sample that shows how to detect when the viewer has stopped watching, but left the video player playing. A message displays over the video player. If the viewer clicks it within a specfied time, playback continues; otherwise the video is paused.

The technique is useful if you have long-form content, or a playlist with auto-advance enabled, and do not want to waste bandwidth on viewers who start the video and then leave it to do something else without bothering to stop it.

item.title: CORS
item.description: Cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) is a mechanism that allows a web page to make requests to another domain other than the one from which the page was served. Normally cross-domain requests would otherwise be forbidden by web browsers. CORS defines a way domains can interact to determine whether or not to allow a cross-origin requests. There are two instances when CORS must be used with Brightcove services/products: *Captions for videos: The file that contains captions for a video can be stored on a non-Brightcove domain. Since the video itself will be served from a Brightcove domain, this will cause cross-domain issues. *New player and HLS: The new player's HLS plugin uses AJAX requests to retrieve the HLS video's manifest and individual segments. Since these HLS resources can be stored on any Internet accessible domain, it is likely these resources will be served from a different server than from the Brightcove domain that served the player. This will again cause cross-domain issues.
